Description: Corroded copper alloy fragment from the headdress of a solid-cast figure of Hathor or Isis with the sun-disc between high cow horns in front of a pair of tall feathers.
Curator's comments: Possibly the bronze "feathers" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49, p.56, p.177, pl.19)
Condition: fair (corroded); only the headdress and part of its base are preserved.
